intro: Staphidium wilsonii var. crinitum, commonly known as the hairy staphidium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy or pubescent surfaces, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
